speaker: IAGO
text_entry: SCENE IV. Before the castle.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Enter DESDEMONA, EMILIA, and Clown

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Do you know, sirrah, where Lieutenant Cassio lies?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I dare not say he lies any where.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, man?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: He's a soldier, and for one to say a soldier lies,

speaker: Clown
text_entry: is stabbing.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Go to: where lodges he?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: To tell you where he lodges, is to tell you where I lie.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Can any thing be made of this?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I know not where he lodges, and for me to devise a

speaker: Clown
text_entry: lodging and say he lies here or he lies there, were

speaker: Clown
text_entry: to lie in mine own throat.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Can you inquire him out, and be edified by report?

speaker: Clown
text_entry: I will catechise the world for him; that is, make

speaker: Clown
text_entry: questions, and by them answer.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Seek him, bid him come hither: tell him I have

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: moved my lord on his behalf, and hope all will be well.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: To do this is within the compass of man's wit: and

speaker: Clown
text_entry: therefore I will attempt the doing it.

speaker: Clown
text_entry: Exit

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Where should I lose that handkerchief, Emilia?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: I know not, madam.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Believe me, I had rather have lost my purse

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Full of crusadoes: and, but my noble Moor

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Is true of mind and made of no such baseness

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: As jealous creatures are, it were enough

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: To put him to ill thinking.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Is he not jealous?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Who, he? I think the sun where he was born

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Drew all such humours from him.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Look, where he comes.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I will not leave him now till Cassio

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Be call'd to him.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Enter OTHELLO

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How is't with you, my lord

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Well, my good lady.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Aside

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: O, hardness to dissemble!--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How do you, Desdemona?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Well, my good lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Give me your hand: this hand is moist, my lady.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It yet hath felt no age nor known no sorrow.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: This argues fruitfulness and liberal heart:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Hot, hot, and moist: this hand of yours requires

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A sequester from liberty, fasting and prayer,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Much castigation, exercise devout;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: For here's a young and sweating devil here,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That commonly rebels. 'Tis a good hand,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A frank one.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: You may, indeed, say so;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: For 'twas that hand that gave away my heart.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A liberal hand: the hearts of old gave hands;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: But our new heraldry is hands, not hearts.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I cannot speak of this. Come now, your promise.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: What promise, chuck?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have sent to bid Cassio come speak with you.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: I have a salt and sorry rheum offends me;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Lend me thy handkerchief.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Here, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That which I gave you.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I have it not about me.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Not?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: No, indeed, my lord.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That is a fault.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: That handkerchief

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Did an Egyptian to my mother give;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: She was a charmer, and could almost read

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The thoughts of people: she told her, while

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: she kept it,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Twould make her amiable and subdue my father

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Entirely to her love, but if she lost it

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Or made gift of it, my father's eye

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Should hold her loathed and his spirits should hunt

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: After new fancies: she, dying, gave it me;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And bid me, when my fate would have me wive,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To give it her. I did so: and take heed on't;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Make it a darling like your precious eye;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: To lose't or give't away were such perdition

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: As nothing else could match.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Is't possible?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: 'Tis true: there's magic in the web of it:

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: A sibyl, that had number'd in the world

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The sun to course two hundred compasses,

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: In her prophetic fury sew'd the work;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The worms were hallow'd that did breed the silk;

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: And it was dyed in mummy which the skilful

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Conserved of maidens' hearts.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Indeed! is't true?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Most veritable; therefore look to't well.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Then would to God that I had never seen't!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Ha! wherefore?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why do you speak so startingly and rash?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Is't lost? is't gone? speak, is it out

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: o' the way?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Heaven bless us!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Say you?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: It is not lost; but what an if it were?

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: How!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I say, it is not lost.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Fetch't, let me see't.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Why, so I can, sir, but I will not now.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: This is a trick to put me from my suit:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Pray you, let Cassio be received again.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Fetch me the handkerchief: my mind misgives.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Come, come;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: You'll never meet a more sufficient man.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The handkerchief!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I pray, talk me of Cassio.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The handkerchief!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: A man that all his time

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Hath founded his good fortunes on your love,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Shared dangers with you,--

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: The handkerchief!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: In sooth, you are to blame.

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Away!

speaker: OTHELLO
text_entry: Exit

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Is not this man jealous?

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I ne'er saw this before.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Sure, there's some wonder in this handkerchief:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I am most unhappy in the loss of it.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: 'Tis not a year or two shows us a man:

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: They are all but stomachs, and we all but food;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: To eat us hungerly, and when they are full,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: They belch us. Look you, Cassio and my husband!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Enter CASSIO and IAGO

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: There is no other way; 'tis she must do't:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, lo, the happiness! go, and importune her.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: How now, good Cassio! what's the news with you?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Madam, my former suit: I do beseech you

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That by your virtuous means I may again

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Exist, and be a member of his love

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Whom I with all the office of my heart

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Entirely honour: I would not be delay'd.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: If my offence be of such mortal kind

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That nor my service past, nor present sorrows,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Nor purposed merit in futurity,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Can ransom me into his love again,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: But to know so must be my benefit;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: So shall I clothe me in a forced content,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And shut myself up in some other course,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: To fortune's alms.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas, thrice-gentle Cassio!

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My advocation is not now in tune;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: My lord is not my lord; nor should I know him,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Were he in favour as in humour alter'd.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: So help me every spirit sanctified,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: As I have spoken for you all my best

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And stood within the blank of his displeasure

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: For my free speech! you must awhile be patient:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: What I can do I will; and more I will

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Than for myself I dare: let that suffice you.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Is my lord angry?

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: He went hence but now,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And certainly in strange unquietness.

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Can he be angry? I have seen the cannon,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: When it hath blown his ranks into the air,

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: And, like the devil, from his very arm

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Puff'd his own brother:--and can he be angry?

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: Something of moment then: I will go meet him:

speaker: IAGO
text_entry: There's matter in't indeed, if he be angry.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I prithee, do so.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Exit IAGO

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Something, sure, of state,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Either from Venice, or some unhatch'd practise

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Made demonstrable here in Cyprus to him,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Hath puddled his clear spirit: and in such cases

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Men's natures wrangle with inferior things,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Though great ones are their object. 'Tis even so;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: For let our finger ache, and it indues

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Our other healthful members even to that sense

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Of pain: nay, we must think men are not gods,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Nor of them look for such observances

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: As fit the bridal. Beshrew me much, Emilia,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I was, unhandsome warrior as I am,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Arraigning his unkindness with my soul;

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: But now I find I had suborn'd the witness,

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And he's indicted falsely.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Pray heaven it be state-matters, as you think,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: And no conception nor no jealous toy

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Concerning you.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Alas the day! I never gave him cause.

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: But jealous souls will not be answer'd so;

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: They are not ever jealous for the cause,

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: But jealous for they are jealous: 'tis a monster

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Begot upon itself, born on itself.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: Heaven keep that monster from Othello's mind!

speaker: EMILIA
text_entry: Lady, amen.

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: I will go seek him. Cassio, walk hereabout:

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: If I do find him fit, I'll move your suit

speaker: DESDEMONA
text_entry: And seek to effect it to my uttermost.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I humbly thank your ladyship.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Exeunt DESDEMONA and EMILIA

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Enter BIANCA

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Save you, friend Cassio!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: What make you from home?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: How is it with you, my most fair Bianca?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I' faith, sweet love, I was coming to your house.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: And I was going to your lodging, Cassio.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: What, keep a week away? seven days and nights?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Eight score eight hours? and lovers' absent hours,

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: More tedious than the dial eight score times?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: O weary reckoning!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Pardon me, Bianca:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I have this while with leaden thoughts been press'd:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: But I shall, in a more continuate time,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Strike off this score of absence. Sweet Bianca,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Giving her DESDEMONA's handkerchief

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Take me this work out.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: O Cassio, whence came this?

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: This is some token from a newer friend:

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: To the felt absence now I feel a cause:

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Is't come to this? Well, well.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Go to, woman!

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Throw your vile guesses in the devil's teeth,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: From whence you have them. You are jealous now

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: That this is from some mistress, some remembrance:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: No, in good troth, Bianca.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Why, whose is it?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I know not, sweet: I found it in my chamber.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I like the work well: ere it be demanded--

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: As like enough it will--I'ld have it copied:

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Take it, and do't; and leave me for this time.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Leave you! wherefore?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: I do attend here on the general;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: And think it no addition, nor my wish,

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: To have him see me woman'd.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Why, I pray you?

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: Not that I love you not.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: But that you do not love me.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: I pray you, bring me on the way a little,

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: And say if I shall see you soon at night.

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: 'Tis but a little way that I can bring you;

speaker: CASSIO
text_entry: For I attend here: but I'll see you soon.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: 'Tis very good; I must be circumstanced.

speaker: BIANCA
text_entry: Exeunt
